  • Constructor Details

      public DateHelper()

  • Method Details

    • getMaxMinDate

      public static Date getMaxMinDate(Date d1, Date d2, boolean max)
      Returns the maximum or minimum of two dates. If one date is null, the other date is returned. If both are null, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      d1 - The first date.
      d2 - The second date.
      max - If true, returns the maximum of the two dates; otherwise, returns the minimum.
      Returns:
      The maximum or minimum date, or one of the dates if the other is null, or null if both are null.

    • getDateDiff

      public static long getDateDiff(Date from, Date to, TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Calculates the difference between two dates in the specified time unit.
      Parameters:
      from - The start date.
      to - The end date.
      timeUnit - The unit of time for the difference (e.g., TimeUnit.DAYS).
      Returns:
      The difference between the two dates in the specified time unit.

    • setTimeToZeroAndAddDay

      public static Date setTimeToZeroAndAddDay(Date date, int addDay)
      Sets the time fields (hour, minute, second, millisecond) of a given date to zero and optionally adds a specified number of days.
      Parameters:
      date - The date to modify.
      addDay - The number of days to add to the date.
      Returns:
      A new Date object with time set to zero and days added.

    • getCalendar

      public static Calendar getCalendar(Date date)
      Converts a Date to a Calendar instance with time fields (hour, minute, second, millisecond) set to zero.
      Parameters:
      date - The date to convert.
      Returns:
      A Calendar instance representing the given date with time set to zero.

    • setTimeToZero

      public static void setTimeToZero(Calendar day)
      Sets the time fields (hour, minute, second, millisecond) of a given Calendar instance to zero.
      Parameters:
      day - The Calendar instance to modify.

    • isToday

      public static boolean isToday(Date date)
      Checks if a date is today.
      Parameters:
      date - the date, not altered, not null.
      Returns:
      true if the date is today.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the date is null

    • isTodayOrAfter

      public static boolean isTodayOrAfter(Date date)
      Checks if a given date is today or any day after today.
      Parameters:
      date - The date to check.
      Returns:
      true if the date is today or in the future, false otherwise.

    • isUntilDateEqualNowOrAfterOrInActualWeekend

      public static boolean isUntilDateEqualNowOrAfterOrInActualWeekend(Date date)
      Checks if a given date is today, or after today, or was part of the most recent weekend (Saturday or Sunday) but only if today is Monday.
      Parameters:
      date - The date to check.
      Returns:
      true if the condition is met, false otherwise.

    • isSameDay

      public static boolean isSameDay(Calendar cal1, Calendar cal2)
      Checks if two calendars represent the same day ignoring time.
      Parameters:
      cal1 - the first calendar, not altered, not null
      cal2 - the second calendar, not altered, not null
      Returns:
      true if they represent the same day
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if either calendar is null

    • isSameDay

      public static boolean isSameDay(Date date1, Date date2)
      Checks if two dates are on the same day ignoring time.
      Parameters:
      date1 - the first date, not altered, not null
      date2 - the second date, not altered, not null
      Returns:
      true if they represent the same day
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if either date is null

    • getLocalDate

      public static LocalDate getLocalDate(Date date)
      Converts a Date object to a LocalDate object using the system's default time zone.
      Parameters:
      date - The Date object to convert.
      Returns:
      The corresponding LocalDate object.

    • getDateFromLocalDate

      public static Date getDateFromLocalDate(LocalDate localDate)
      Converts a LocalDate object to a Date object. The time is set to the start of the day in the system's default time zone.
      Parameters:
      localDate - The LocalDate object to convert. Can be null.
      Returns:
      The corresponding Date object, or null if localDate is null.

    • LocalDateToEpocheSeconds

      public static long LocalDateToEpocheSeconds(LocalDate localDate)
      Converts a LocalDate object to the number of seconds since the epoch (January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT). The conversion uses the start of the day in the system's default time zone.
      Parameters:
      localDate - The LocalDate object to convert.
      Returns:
      The number of seconds since the epoch.

    • convertToDateViaInstant

      public static Date convertToDateViaInstant(LocalDateTime dateToConvert)
      Converts a LocalDateTime object to a Date object using the system's default time zone.
      Parameters:
      dateToConvert - The LocalDateTime object to convert.
      Returns:
      The corresponding Date object.
